results.title: Suspected PowerShell Execution via Microsoft Word Document
results.summary: An uncommon event occurred where a user (sarah.jones) opened an attachment (invoice_march2026.docm), leading to the execution of PowerShell commands. This behavior is unusual and raises concerns as such activities can potentially lead to malware infections or data breaches.
investigation_steps: Inspect the contents of the attachment for any malicious content or macros
Analyze network traffic for any unusual outbound connections
Review system logs for related events in the last 48 hours
Isolate the host (DESKTOP-HR04) for further investigation
results.verdict: Investigate potential malicious activity; take immediate action to secure the affected system

results.title: Potential Command and Control (C&C) Communication
results.summary: An outbound connection from the host 10.0.1.45 was blocked to a known Tor exit node and C2 server at IP 185.220.101.47 on port 4444 for 12 minutes, transferring 2.3MB of data. This could indicate an attempt to communicate with a malicious actor.
investigation_steps: Inspect the process that initiated the connection for malicious behavior or unknown software
Analyze network traffic patterns around the time of the alert to identify unusual activity
Check logs for any other related connections or suspicious events
Scan the host for known malware signatures and indicators of compromise
results.verdict: Investigate further as this could be an attempt at a compromised system communicating with a C&C server.

results.title: Account Lockout Detected
results.summary: A user (john.smith) has exceeded the maximum number of failed login attempts within a minute from multiple IP addresses (192.168.1.102, 192.168.1.103, 192.168.1.104). This may indicate a brute force attack or an attempt to guess the password.
investigation_steps: Inspect login logs for more attempts
Check if a password spray or brute force attack is in progress
Analyze the compromised account's permissions and recent activity
Investigate any unusual network traffic from the involved IP addresses
Reset the user's password
results.verdict: Potential account compromise, initiate password reset and further investigation.

results.title: Unauthorized Data Exfiltration by Departing Employee
results.summary: The user mike.chen from the Finance department has downloaded an unusual amount of data (4.7GB in 8 minutes) and transferred sensitive files to personal cloud storage. This activity is highly suspicious, especially given that the user submitted a resignation yesterday.
investigation_steps: Review the logs for any other suspicious activities by mike.chen prior to his resignation.
Investigate the content of the downloaded files.
Secure the personal cloud storage account.
Notify the IT department to revoke mike.chen's access credentials.
results.verdict: Potential data breach by departing employee. Investigate immediately and take appropriate actions.

results.title: CVE-2021-44228 (Log4Shell) Exploitation Detected
results.summary: An exploit for the Log4Shell vulnerability (CVE-2021-44228) was detected on an internal Java Application Server running an unpatched version of Log4j. The server is being targeted by a payload using ldap protocol, which could lead to remote code execution.
investigation_steps: Identify the specific Java application affected by the vulnerability
Check logs for any signs of further exploitation or data exfiltration
Implement temporary mitigations while patching is being performed
Apply the appropriate Log4j patch for the affected version
Review and update incident response plan to handle future Log4Shell incidents
results.verdict: Unpatched Log4j server under active attack, urgent action required to patch and mitigate

results.title: Unsigned Malware Executable Created on DESKTOP-FIN02
results.summary: An unsigned executable named 'svchost32.exe' was created in the public directory of HOST: DESKTOP-FIN02 via a scheduled task named 'WindowsUpdate_Helper'. The file has been flagged as malicious by 34 out of 68 antivirus engines, indicating a high likelihood of a security compromise.
investigation_steps: Check for signs of lateral movement within the network, such as unusual file access or network traffic.
Extract and analyze the contents of the scheduled task to determine its purpose.
Run additional antivirus scans on the affected host.
Investigate the user account that created the scheduled task.
results.verdict: Immediate response required: Potential malware infection detected on DESKTOP-FIN02

results.title: CEO Impersonation Phishing Attempt Detected
results.summary: An email impersonating the CEO was detected, requesting an urgent wire transfer of $85,000. The domain associated with the email is only two days old and has been targeted towards multiple finance employees.
mitre_techniques: T1566.002 - Valid Accounts: Corporate Account Use
investigation_steps: Inspect the email headers for further information
Review the targeted employees' email activity logs
Check if any wire transfers were initiated from the identified accounts
Research the new domain for potential malicious activities
Alert other employees about the phishing attempt
results.verdict: Urgent: Wire transfer action should be halted immediately

results.title: Possible Ransomware Attack on SERVER-PROD-01
results.summary: A large number of files have been encrypted in a short period of time, shadow copies have been deleted, and a ransom note has been dropped. A high CPU process associated with encryption was also detected.
mitre_techniques: Data Stolen for Further Exploitation, Exfiltration Over Command-and-Control Channel — T1041
investigation_steps: Investigate the origin of the ransomware
Recover encrypted files from backups if available
Analyze network traffic for additional compromised hosts
Check email logs for phishing attempts
Isolate and forensically analyze SERVER-PROD-01
results.verdict: Immediate action required to contain the ransomware and recover data.

results.title: Unauthorized Access Attempt - Password Reset and Admin AWS
results.summary: Alex Kumar accessed multiple password reset pages, which is unusual and may indicate a brute-force attack or compromised account. Additionally, access to admin level AWS resources was detected without a corresponding helpdesk ticket for a password issue.
investigation_steps: Review user account activity logs for unusual behavior, check for any successful login attempts or data exfiltration.
Investigate the network traffic and identify any potential sources of the attack.
Check for any multi-factor authentication settings and enforce them if not already in place.
Review password policies and consider implementing password rotation and complex password requirements.
results.verdict: Immediate investigation required to mitigate potential unauthorized access.
